TEXT.citation: Early, R. J., & Whitehorn, J. (2003). One hundred Paiwan texts. Pacific Linguistics, Research School of Pacific and Asian Studies, The Australian National University.
TEXT.BibTeX_citation: @book{100paiwantexts, author = {Robert Early and John Whitehorn}, title = {One Hundred Paiwan Texts}, year = {2003}, publisher = {Pacific Linguistics, Research School of Pacific and Asian Studies, The Australian National University}}

S.FORM: pai, sinsi, qai anga sun.
pai, sinsi, qai anga son.
S.TRANSL: We remember you with affection, teacher.

S.FORM: ki sun a vaik anga i maza i Tayuang.
ki son a vaik anga i maza i Tayoang.
S.TRANSL: So you are leaving (us) here in Taiwan,

S.FORM: ki sun a djemałun itua mareka tja kaka i Igiris.
ki son a djemaljon itoa mareka tja kaka i Igiris.
S.TRANSL: and are going to our brothers and sisters in England.

S.FORM: pai nu vaik sun, pai kiqauqaungan amen uta tua tja kama Tsemas tusa nia saqetjuan uta.
pai no vaik son, pai kiqaoqaongan amen ota toa tja kama Cemas tosa nia saqetjoan ota.
S.TRANSL: Well when you go pray for us too to our Father God because of our illnesses too.

S.FORM: pai małimałi aravats, Uaitu sinsi, aitsu a su kinasi Tayuangan.
pai maljimalji aravac, Uaito sinsi, aico a so kinasi Tayoangan.
S.TRANSL: Thank you very much, teacher Whitehorn, during your time in Taiwan

S.FORM: napadjałudjałun sun tjanuamen, nazemuker sun uta i tjanuamen i Kazazałan.
napadjaljodjaljon son tjanoamen, nazemoker son ota i tjanoamen i Kazazaljan.
S.TRANSL: you came to us, you also reached us in Kazazałan.

S.FORM: pai małimałi aravats.
pai maljimalji aravac.
malevaleva men aravats.
malevaleva men aravac.
łakua pai aitsu, Uaitu sinsi, nu djemałun sun itua mareka tja kaka, qai anga tazua, ki sun aya anga uta tjanuamen a mapułat a imaza i Tayuang.
ljakoa pai aico, Uaito sinsi, no djemaljon son itoa mareka tja kaka, qai anga tazoa, ki son aya anga ota tjanoamen a mapoljat a imaza i Tayoang.
S.TRANSL: But now, teacher Whitehorn, when you reach our brothers and sisters, you will remember with affection all of us here in Taiwan.

S.FORM: pai nu izuanga sun uta itua mareka tja kaka, ki men a su sikiqauqaungan uta sakamaya tua tja Kama i vavaw.
pai no izoanga son ota itoa mareka tja kaka, ki men a so sikiqaoqaongan ota sakamaya toa tja Kama i vavaw.
S.TRANSL: And when you are there with our brothers and sisters, you will certainly pray for us to our Father above.

S.FORM: pai nu ika men a sa makapidał uta, ki tjen a metsevutsevung anga i kalevelevan, nu napasusu amen tua su tulu ta su pazazekazekatj.
pai no ika men a sa makapidalj ota, ki tjen a mecevocevong anga i kalevelevan, no napasoso amen toa so tolo ta so pazazekazekatj.
S.TRANSL: And if we don’t last so many days, we will meet in heaven, if we fulfil your teaching and commands.

S.FORM: pai amin a ?u kai.
pai amin a ?o kai.
S.TRANSL: Well that’s all I have to say.

S.FORM: qai anga sun.
qai anga son.
